programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: They've been called the world's greatest archaeological enigma: 2,000-year-old geoglyphs made in the Peruvian desert that span over 50 miles; the drawings are so massive, they can only be seen from the air.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: During World War Two, the Nazis stole vast amounts of art, gold, silver and currency, and stashed it across Europe; while some of the plunder has been recovered, much more is still missing nearly 80 years later.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: A powerful union activist disappears from a Detroit suburb; 45 years later, it remains one of the most notorious missing person cases of all time; the mystery of Jimmy Hoffa's disappearance features more twists and turns than a Hollywood movie.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: On Christmas morning in 1945, five siblings vanish from their family home in West Virginia during a raging fire; despite the work of dozens of investigators and thousands of amateur sleuths, the mystery remains.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Whether surviving freezing temperatures, diving unfathomable depths in one breath, or lifting weighty objects, superhuman feats never cease to amaze; pulling them off could be a matter of training, willpower, genetics, or something more mysterious.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Perhaps the greatest unexplained mystery of all is: what happens to us after we die? Perhaps clues to the answer lie in unusual cases of near-death experience.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Some archeological finds are so baffling, they challenge what is known about the past; learning the truth about these mysterious ruins and answering the questions they continue to present.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: From the ancient Babylonians to modern-day urban explorers, mankind has always been fascinated by abandoned places; discovering the allure that draws people to post-apocalyptic landscapes.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: All over the world are forbidden "triangles" that are mysterious regions where ships, planes and people enter and then just disappear; they are found in Bermuda, Alaska, Japan and elsewhere.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: More than 80% of the Earth's oceans remain unexplored, and in many ways, the underwater world is the final frontier; as new technology allows people to explore oceans and deep lakes more than ever before, nobody knows what they will find.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: King Arthur, England's first pop culture superhero; his exploits inspired blockbuster movies and television series like "Middle Earth", "Harry Potter", "Game of Thrones" and "Star Wars"; the significant impact of Arthurian legend on Western culture.

programme.desc: More than 80% of the Earth's oceans remain unexplored, and in many ways, the underwater world is the final frontier; as new technology allows people to explore oceans and deep lakes more than ever before, nobody knows what they will find.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: King Arthur, England's first pop culture superhero; his exploits inspired blockbuster movies and television series like "Middle Earth", "Harry Potter", "Game of Thrones" and "Star Wars"; the significant impact of Arthurian legend on Western culture.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Whether surviving freezing temperatures, diving unfathomable depths in one breath, or lifting weighty objects, superhuman feats never cease to amaze; pulling them off could be a matter of training, willpower, genetics, or something more mysterious.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Perhaps the greatest unexplained mystery of all is: what happens to us after we die? Perhaps clues to the answer lie in unusual cases of near-death experience.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: One of the most well-known serial killers, Richard Ramirez terrorized Southern California in the mid-1980s, where anyone could be a target of the sadistic murderer.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: The articulate and boastful killer is remembered for terrifying the coastal town of Santa Cruz, where he picked up and dismembered hitchhiking college students in the early 1970s.

programme.title: Evil Up Close
programme.desc: On a busy platform at a train station in Bologna in 2012, a jealous husband shocked commuters by pulling out a knife on his estranged wife's lover.

programme.title: Evil Up Close
programme.desc: Mark Shirley's desires drove him to torture, stab, and murder a long list of women.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: At the 2000 All-Star Game, Derek Jeter and Chipper Jones both go 3-for-3. The American League scores three insurance runs in the top of the 9th inning to secure their 6-3 victory over the National League.

programme.title: Epic Moments
programme.desc: In one of the greatest single-game World Series performances of all-time, Pablo Sandoval gets the Giants off and running with a three-homer game in Game 1 against the Tigers.

programme.title: All-Star Highlights
programme.desc: MLB stars from the AL and NL face off in Toronto at the second All-Star Game ever played outside the United States.

programme.title: MLB Docs
programme.desc: A look back at the 2000 Subway Series between the New York Yankees and New York Mets

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.desc: MLB Network looks back at the career of "The Hit Man" in Donnie Baseball, the latest installment of the MLB Network Presents series

programme.title: Epic Innings
programme.desc: Relive top moments from 1995-1999, including Cal Ripken Jr. becoming baseball's Iron Man, David Wells' perfection in pinstripes, and more.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1991 matchup between the Twins and the Braves. Both teams went from worst to first before battling it out in a close series that showcased five games decided by one run and the Twins securing the World Series title.

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.desc: MLB Network takes a deep look into the life and career of legendary Reds hall of fame catcher Johnny Bench

programme.title: MLB Docs
programme.desc: The 1995 Indians made the playoffs and would make their way to their first World Series since 1954.

programme.title: Baseball's Seasons
programme.desc: Willie Stargell leads "We Are Family" Pirates to face Orioles in 1979 World Series.

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.desc: Terry Francona is a baseball lifer and world champion. MLB Network explores what makes Tito one of baseball's most beloved personalities

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Having set a modern-day record for most wins in the regular season, the Yankees faced the Padres and established themselves as one of the best teams to ever put on the Pinstripes.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Benny Agbayani's go-ahead grand slam in the 11th wins it for the Mets in Tokyo, Japan.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 3/17/09: David Wright clinches a finals berth for Team USA with a bases-clearing walk-off hit in the 9th inning.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Throughout his career, throwing a no-hitter was one accolade that had eluded Hall of Famer Tom Seaver. There were many close calls and one-hitters, but finally on June 16, 1978, Tom Terrific made history with the Reds and kept the Cardinals hitless.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Todd Helton hits three homers in a game for the second time, leading the Rockies to a 12-5 win over the Dodgers.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Bryce Harper found himself as the hometown favorite when it came to the 2018 Home Run Derby at Nationals Park in D.C. The former MVP put on a show for the fans, taking down Freddie Freeman, Max Muncy and Kyle Schwarber on his way to an exciting victory.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Jim Leyritz hits an iconic 3-run HR in the 8th that allowed the Yankees to win in the 10th inning

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The first World Series to be played in an indoor ballpark, the Twins used their familiarity with the Metrodome to their advantage to capture their first World Series Championship since moving to Minnesota.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Paul Blair hits a walk-off single to give the Yankees a Game 1 win in the 1977 World Series

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: The National League battles back twice late in a thrilling victory, highlighted by clutch hits from Fred McGriff and Moises Alou. The 1994 MLB All-Star Game was the first NL win since 1987.

programme.title: Epic Innings
programme.desc: "The Mets' Amazin' rally vs. the Red Sox, Kirk Gibson's 'impossible' homer and more.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Scott Rolen hit a two-run homer off Randy Johnson in Game 1 of the 2002 NLDS, his first postseason HR.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 10/11/03: Tempers were rising between the Red Sox and Yankees in the 2003 ALCS. After plenty of jawing from both teams, the benches eventually cleared which led to Pedro Martinez tossing 72-year-old Don Zimmer to the ground during the scuffle.

programme.desc: The crew takes a stock 2015 Ford F-150 and turns it into a Raptor clone.

programme.desc: The crew takes on an '09 370Z with a checkered past and a Corvette engine.

programme.desc: The team takes a stock Victory gunner and turns it into a modern bobber.

programme.desc: The crew modifies a 2015 Ford F-150 ready to protect them from zombies.

programme.desc: The team upgrades the front and rear suspension on a 1970 Camaro Z28.

programme.desc: Find out what makes a purpose-built 1972 Chevelle SS “Pro Touring.”

programme.desc: The girls make a custom fix to 1973 Gremlin X to get it back on the road.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Three different platform BMW motorcycles for three different tastes.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team preps a pair of vintage sprint cars for racing and more.

programme.desc: The team lends a hand with a Cobra MKIII build for a charity raffle.

programme.desc: The girls turn a freshly painted '66 Chevelle into a chromed-out Malibu.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls build a custom black and red Jeep monster for resale.

programme.desc: The crew upgrades a failing twin-turbo EcoBoost in a 2011 Ford F-150.

programme.desc: The girls install a bolt-on supercharger on a brand new Camaro.

programme.desc: The girls add a pair of turbos and an intercooler to a race-only BMW.

programme.desc: The AGG team saves a '66 GTO from the body shop.

programme.desc: The car may be small, but the AGG team finds out the work load is heavy.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls take a rare chance to work an original 1967 Shelby GT500.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The AGG team adds a newly rebuilt engine and trans to a '63 Volvo P1800.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team brings in an Auburn Speedster kit car with some serious problems.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team gets a numbers-matching Buick Gran Sport back on the road.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team brings in a pair of panel trucks for engine and body work.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A local Camaro club has brought in a few stock Camaros for modifications.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '61 Eldorado convertible has some power accessories that need attention.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Cristy stops into the shop in the middle of a motorcycle tour of Florida.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew helps a wife track down a '67 Firebird her husband sold years ago.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew fixes the hide-away headlights and AC on a '67 Camaro RS-SS.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 2017 Corvette Grand Sport needs just one thing to push it over the top.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team rebuilds the bucket seats and interior on a '70 Dodge Challenger.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Cristy wants to get her Grandma's Grand Prix back on the road.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A man brings his dad's '82 Corvette to the shop for an interior makeover.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team restores and then flips a vintage '63 split-window Corvette.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Cristy talks Rachel and Bogi into helping her restore and flip a Yamaha R6.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew takes drastic measures to seal all of a '69 Cougar's leaks.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew checks off items from a wish list for a military mom's Mustang.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew finds some parts to give a '78 Mustang some new life.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi finds a BMW M3 she wants for herself, but it needs a lot of work.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team beefs up a Scat Pack Challenger with twin turbos and new axles.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '69 Cutlass needs a new top, plus a lot of work on the interior.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '33 Ford Roadster with a dead cylinder is getting a new 355 crate engine.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '53 F-100 on a '99 Lightning chassis has been in project mode for years.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A rare '89 Turbo Trans Am gets items knocked off the owner's wish list.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '75 El Camino swaps its bench seat for bucket seats and a center console.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 2011 Jeep Wrangler is a reliable and fun vehicle to drive off to college.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team builds two Indian Scout Bobbers, each with a distinct personality.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The forgotten Mustang is back to have its leaky 302 engine replaced.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A special guest helps build a new Ford F-150 that will be sold for charity.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A Polaris Slingshot and a Vanderhall are in the shop for some upgrades.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '65 C10 lowrider gets a new all-electronic 4L60E transmission.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: An autocross Malibu wagon needs work some on the steering before race day.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team retrofits a Jeepster Commando with a custom power-steering setup.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '71 Lincoln gets a boost in power and fuel economy by adding EFI.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls bring back a vintage Jeepster Commando and convert its vintage brakes from drum to disc.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Addressing what type of maintenance is needed on a company's work truck; the girls demonstrate general maintenance, fix some broken items and give it an upgrade or two.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls tackle an incomplete, but drivable Pontiac GTO convertible by replacing the mechanics in the convertible top and putting on new exterior pieces.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 2005 Jeep TJ Wrangler Rubicon is in the All Girls Garage because its owner wants to be able to use it off-road; it will need a new long arm suspension kit, new roll cage and new tires.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 1966 Ford Mustang Coupe had an extensive renovation in 2009, but there are a few items that still need to be finished; the girls will address a couple of interior and exterior items to take this restoration project to the finish line.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 1989 Toyota Supra has twin turbos and a potent straight 6 engine; the girls will switch out the twin turbos for a single and get more power out of the 1JZ motor; Faye's windshield gets rescued from a rock chip that could be disastrous.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 1971 Pontiac LeMans is brought into the shop with an overheating issue; the crew will upgrade the car's radiator and add electric fans, then go to work replacing some worn interior parts as well.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: One of the lifters in a 1971 Chevy Camaro has stopped working; the team will have to remove the engine in order to upgrade the camshaft, lifters, bearings, and timing chain before putting it all back together.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew gets one of the first Honda Civic Type R's into the shop; the car is already a powerhouse, but it's not good enough for the track, so they will give it some modifications and upgrades to make it race-worthy.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The AGG team performs some minor repairs and adjustments to a 1966 Nova Super Sport so the owner can quickly flip it.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The gang brings a 1976 J10 into the garage for comparison as they personalize a 2020 Jeep Gladiator for a customer.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The gang installs upgrades to a 2017 Ford Mustang GT they find for an empty-nester mom who is looking for some excitement in her life.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '69 Corvette gets a top-end rebuild and a factory exhaust reinstall.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 2018 Kia stinger GT goes from beast to monster with aftermarket goodies.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '71 Oldsmobile Cutlass goes from an automatic transmission to a manual.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: An '03 BMW 325i needs a timing chain and has a parasitic electrical draw.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '69 Mustang with a supercharged engine needs more throttle response.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls find a stock Mercedes-AMG E 55 and do some European hot rodding.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: An MGB with a Ford Ranger engine isn't running the correct fuel setup.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A Camaro swaps out its 305 small block for a 383 that will make 450hp.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew diagnoses and fixes some problems on a Dodge Avenger; they demonstrate how to know when motor mounts are bad, and how to easily fix a cracked bumper.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team brings in a stock supercharged CTS-V and converts it to twin turbos; they put an intake manifold where the supercharger was, and then put in a new exhaust that includes turbos.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: This mid-engine classic needs to get back on the road; the crew goes through the engine to see if it needs a rebuild, then overhauls the fuel delivery system to get this build over some major hurdles.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team brings back the 442 Tribute car to give it a new LS engine and finish modifying the interior for the previously-installed TKO transmission.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Four gears are better than two, so the crew takes the old two-speed Powerglide out of a '67 Chevy Camaro and installs a Muncie four speed.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The new-generation, mid-engine Corvette is here, and the girls take one for a test drive; the C8 is already cool, but they make it better with aftermarket exhaust and some other goodies.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls bring in Faye's 1980 VW Rabbit for some fabrication.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls have to figure out why an '87 C10 isn't running anymore; they know it's a fuel problem that happened after an EFI setup was installed; they finish up with a new disc-brake kit; Bogi takes a field trip to show how custom fuel lines are made.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye show how to rebuild and upgrade an R154 manual transmission so it will last as long as the Toyota engine; they also drop a valve body on an automatic transmission, drilling it out and adding stronger sleeves to keep it lasting longer.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls take an old AMC Spirit drag car and get it ready for the street by changing out the oversized carb. They bring in a special guest to help them pick out the right carb and tune it on the car.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls bring in a rare Caprice cop car to bolt on a supercharger from a second-generation CTS-V; they'll make brackets for the intercooler, bolt on the supercharger and give the rare cop car some extra power.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Cars die of boredom, so it wasn't great for a Plymouth Prowler to sit in a museum for 15 years; the girls show what areas to fix before the car gets back on the road.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye describe a common failure problem on a fifth-generation Camaro. The torque converter can fail in the transmission, causing the car to shake at 40-50 mph. The girls upgrade the factory torque converter to fix this problem for good.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye show how a worn-out Toyota's steering rack and pinion works, where they fail, and how to rebuild it with a simple rebuild kit.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A GTO that has spent a lot of its life in shops with mechanics who had no intention of finishing it, is brought in by its owner for some final touches, including checking gauges, air conditioning and the steering column.

programme.title: Clover
programme.desc: When her father dies shortly after his remarriage, a young African American girl struggles to cope while left in the care of her new, white stepmom.

programme.title: My Other Mother
programme.desc: Adopted as a child, an anchorwoman finds herself reconnecting with her birth mother and extended family while attending the funeral of her father.

programme.title: Christmas With the Carters
programme.desc: When their Christmas gift budget is destroyed by the theft of an expensive watch, a family must band together to find it and steal it back by surviving the most chaotic Christmas Eve of their lives.

programme.title: Endless Summer
programme.desc: A man who has been dreaming of the love of his life has one last day to be noticed by her, but his obnoxious family and her boyfriend get in the way.

programme.desc: Gabby and her family spend one last Christmas in LA with her dying mom, where secrets are revealed that could threaten their tranquility.

programme.title: For the Love of Christmas
programme.desc: Rashad Williams faces down the pressures of making a dramatic career choice and getting married to Lauren—and all before Christmas Day.

programme.title: A True Christmas
programme.desc: Reminded of her past, Jessica can't stand Christmas, but this holiday season has several surprises in store that will help her create new memories.

programme.title: Single Bells
programme.desc: When the Bell sisters lose their family restaurant during Christmas, they hatch a plan to save it—and unexpectedly find romance along the way.

programme.title: Resurrecting the Champ
programme.desc: A struggling sports reporter sees a career opportunity when he rescues a homeless man only to discover that he is a boxing legend long thought dead.

programme.title: Coming Home For Christmas
programme.desc: Coming from mixed backgrounds, adopted siblings Smythe, Hanna, Bea, Shane and Lonny, along with parents Pat and Samantha, will have to search for a higher spirit to get them through the holiday season.

programme.title: It Ain’t Easy

programme.title: Mixed Christmas

programme.title: The Searchers
programme.desc: In this revered Western, Ethan Edwards (John Wayne) returns home to Texas after the Civil War. When members of his brother's family are killed or abducted by Comanches, he vows to track down his surviving relatives and bring them home. Eventually, Edwards gets word that his niece Debbie (Natalie Wood) is alive, and, along with her adopted brother, Martin Pawley (Jeffrey Hunter), he embarks on a dangerous mission to find her, journeying deep into Comanche territory.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: When an English couple comes to the Ponderosa, the wife expresses disappointment in her husband, a great hunter who is becoming more peaceful.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A janitor-turned-gunfighter's reputation hangs on one lucky shot and a lot of gall. The handyman finds himself in trouble when he accidentally kills another gunfighter.

programme.title: Sergeant Rutledge
programme.desc: At a U.S. Army fort in the Arizona Territory in 1881, an officer is murdered and his beautiful young daughter is beaten, raped and strangled. Army lawyer Tom Cantrell (Jeffrey Hunter) defends the accused, African-American sergeant Braxton Rutledge (Woody Strode), a soldier who had once been under his command. Under questioning by Cantrell and the prosecutor (Carleton Young), multiple witnesses piece together the truth of what happened at the fort that day.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Duke and his gang frame Sam plus kidnap Linda to keep him from proving his innocence. Annie and Lofty must stop a lynch mob lead by Howard, save Linda while proving Duke's guilt.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Annie Oakley's young brother and his friend runaway because they feel like they get no respect. They come across an empty town and get in trouble with The Shadow Gang who rob stage coaches.

programme.title: Annie Oakley

programme.title: Annie Oakley

programme.title: Annie Oakley

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Link and Evie Tabor have been struggling, working their ranch, ever since Link was injured in a rodeo mishap and confined to a wheel chair.

programme.title: Kit Carson
programme.desc: At Fort Bridger in the Wyoming Territory, frontiersman and scout Kit Carson (Jon Hall) receives a request to guide a wagon train over the Oregon Trail to California. Concerned by the dangers of Indian attacks, Carson hesitates, but then agrees despite the wagon train having already arranged for protection from a cavalry unit led by Capt. John Fremont (Dana Andrews). On the journey, Caron and Fremont clash several times over leadership -- and the attentions of Dolores Murphy (Lynn Bari).

programme.desc: Sheriff Gene is up against a newspaperman who prints headlines reporting crimes before they are committed.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: A crusading newspaperwoman tries to clean up a lawless community single-handedly.

programme.desc: Gene and Pat help a courageous old lady defend a ranch after the owner is murdered.

programme.desc: Gene must apprehend a group of outlaws harassing Pat as he tries to operate a dry-goods store.

programme.desc: Gene and Pat help a reformed outlaw and his daughter when a rich and unscrupulous man tries to blackmail them.

programme.title: El Condor
programme.desc: After escaping from a chain gang, Luke (Jim Brown) partners with tough prospector Jaroo (Lee Van Cleef) to search for gold in a Mexican fort. The enterprising duo manage to convince Apache chief Santana (Iron Eyes Cody) and his tribe to help them infiltrate the fort, which is defended by Mexican military officer Chavez (Patrick O'Neal) and his men. While things don't go according to plan, Chavez's lover, Claudine (Mariana Hill), falls for Luke, which proves helpful to the scrappy bandits.

programme.desc: A bandit (Peter Graves) and his gang target a Mexican general's trainload of gold for the revolution in 1914.

programme.desc: From an Elmore Leonard book.

programme.title: Rio Bravo
programme.desc: When gunslinger Joe Burdette (Claude Akins) kills a man in a saloon, Sheriff John T. Chance (John Wayne) arrests him with the aid of the town drunk, Dude (Dean Martin). Before long, Burdette's brother, Nathan (John Russell), comes around, indicating that he's prepared to bust his brother out of jail if necessary. Chance decides to make a stand until reinforcements arrive, enlisting Dude, an old cripple named Stumpy (Walter Brennan) and baby-faced cowboy Colorado Ryan (Ricky Nelson) to help.

programme.title: The Train Robbers
programme.desc: After the death of her husband, Mrs. Lowe (Ann-Margret) posts a $50,000 reward in return for help recovering her train-robber beau's hidden fortune, under the pretense of returning it. Lane (John Wayne) assembles a group of cowboys to head to Mexico with Mrs. Lowe, enticed by the reward money. As they cross into Mexico, however, they realize they're being followed, by both a posse of bandits and a single mysterious rider (Ricardo Montalban) with his own agenda.

programme.title: A Miracle on Christmas Lake
programme.desc: After suffering the loss of his best friend Charlie on Christmas Eve, sixteen year old Bobby Whiteside ventures out onto the lake where they played countless games of winter hockey. Upon shoveling the ice surface he makes a shocking discovery --- a magic, perfectly groomed hockey rink that appears only at night and only in his presence. When a local construction company purchases the land for development, Bobby must join forces with his high school crush, rally the town, and play one last game on the night pond --- with an old friend.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Brighton Surf Hotel, Jeremy Mann and his Russian wife Elena hope their hands-off hosting style will win the day, despite the lack of breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Number 16, in Greenwich, London. Owner Robert Gray, an actor and antiques dealer, charms with his hosting, but Jan and Les find the dusty decor off-putting.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Fleur de Lis in Sandwich in Kent, hosts Jan and Les Fisher are convinced that their traditional place will impress their guests, but Robert is bent on revenge.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to The Barn at Dale End House near Matlock in the Peak District, owned by Sarah Summers. Sarah is dreading Robert's arrival, but all the guests are bowled over.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Starting in Betws-y-coed, North Wales, where at Llwyn Onn Guest House, bikers Wayne and Tracy Dunn hope their no-nonsense attitude will win the competition.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Parkwood Hotel in Stockton on Tees, where newlywed managers Jon and Chelli Bean are all about making things perfect for pooches.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Great Glen in Leicestershire and The Pug and Greyhound, where Nicola Ellershaw and her colleague, Mackenzie Griffey, hope their super-stylish accommodation will dazzle.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Solar Strand Hotel in Crosskeys, Wales, where former IT consultant Gary Pesticcio and his daughter, Naomi, hope their high-tech B&B will power them to victory.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at The Shoes, Durham, where landlord Billy Gowland and partner Debbie Nelson hope their footwear-themed pub BandB is the right fit for their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Biggin Hall Hotel in Derbyshire, where owner James Moffat and partner Annie Larner hope the BandBers will fall for the rural charm of their 17th-century farmhouse.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit the group head to yurt glamp-site, Forest Garden Shovelstrode in East Sussex, where hosts Charles and Lisa Hooper hope the BandBers buy into their woodland retreat.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Derby Manor Hotel and Restaurant run by mother and son team Fiona and James Milligan who opened their doors eight months ago after a million pound refurbishment.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Hope Mountain in North Wales, where husband and wife team, Rob and Jo Smith hope their dog-friendly B&B will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Beaumont Hotel in Louth, near Lincoln, where managers and best friends, Steffi Stevenson and Sarah Banks, pride themselves on being the `queens of clean'.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Rock House Hotel in Lynmouth, Devon, where owner Emilio Tundidor is assisted by his identical twin brother Fernando.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Troy House in Painswick, where owners Alan and Denise Newman hope their guests will fall in love with their rooms.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Flying the flag on day two are Norfolk couple Jenny and Richard Harmer, from Chimneys B&B in North Walsham.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Copperfields Guest House in Broadstairs, Kent, where owners Neale and Julie Taylor hope their exclusively vegetarian B&B will stand out from the crowd.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week the group head to The George and Abbotsford in Melrose, Scotland, where host Andrea Gardner and front of house manager John Marr pull out all the stops.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Massimo's in Seaham, County Durham, where Italian chef Massimo Perrulli is joined by his cousin, Raf, on front of house. Emotions run riot as things come to a head.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This competition kicks off in Malvern, Worcestershire where retired pro-rugby player Steve Lloyd and partner Kathy Leather open their Copper Beech House to fellow B&B owners.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the pet friendly Dog in a Doublet pub and restaurant in Peterborough where Della McGinn's passion for animals comes a close second to husband John's passion for food.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week, the B&Bers head to the Torcroft Boutique B&B in Torquay, Devon, where Europhiles Phil and Sharon Hobson hope their added extras will win over their rivals.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the 600-year-old Rhydspence Inn in Herefordshire, owned by Mark and Lowrie Price. All guests are charmed by the medieval inn, but there's still underlying tension.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Maldon, Essex and The White Horse Inn, where hospitality expert Jayne and her husband, Pete Kocinoga, hope their attention to detail will win over their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Barnfield B&B in St Osyth, Essex, run by Christine and her toy boy husband Paul Harman. Here, as well as offering rooms, Christine also runs spiritual retreats.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit the group head to The Black Swan Inn in Pickering, Yorkshire, where Phil and Jill have spent large sums to bring their 18th century inn up to their exacting standards.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Delamere Farm in Northborough, where owner Agi Chapman, who is joined by Jayne Thorpe Godman, prides herself on providing a luxurious sleep to all her visitors.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Harrogate where management team Chris `Clarky' Clarke and Katie Light help run the White Hart Hotel. The guests meet some llamas and the extra charge for fancy coffee causes a stir.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to New Promenade Hotel in Blackpool, owned by Raouf, who is joined by friend Chrissie. There's a teetering toilet seat and Clarky and Katie find muck on the taps.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Vicky's small terraced house, aptly named The Terrace, in Oxford. On inspection, two pairs of guests discover an array of filthy finds, including a pre-sucked sweet.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Robin and Liza's Georgian mansion Tall John's House in the Brecon Beacons. At dinner the guests gush over their new friendships but Vicky doesn't share their feelings.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Hillcroft in Torquay, where husband and wife team Martyn and Elaine Flint hope their lovingly decorated adults-only B&B will prove a hit with their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit sees Sam and Henry confident that their five-star rooms above a quintessential English country pub, The Bear and Swan, in Chew Magna, Somerset, will impress their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Guesthouse East in Eastbourne, where childhood sweethearts Tony and Lisa hope their guests will fall head over heels for their family friendly B&B.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Shirley B&B in Bournemouth, where Jorge Mesquita hopes to impress his guests with his all-round cleanliness and the power of his showers.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Kicking off the competition in Anglesey are newbie owners Neil and Lavinia Walker who run Castellor B&B, where it's all about going the extra mile. But the in-room extras fail to impress.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Marlow Lodge in Blackpool, where owner Deano Whiting prides himself on delivering the fun factor.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Third to host this week is manager James Hall and owner's son Adam Neale of The Black Swan in Horsham St Faith, a luxury roomed establishment with onsite restaurant and pub.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: S01:E10 - Special Occasions

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
The episode that has gone down in TV history. Tim Gray was the 21 year-old Head Chef at Bonaparte's in Silsden, West Yorkshire. Claiming to specialise in "fine dining", he had ambitions to be a TV chef and dreamed of opening restaurants in London, Paris and New York. Unfortunately, Tim couldn't even cook an omelette and his trademark scallops made Ramsay throw up. A true kitchen nightmare if ever there was one.
With no customers and a fridge full of fancy ingredients, Bonaparte's was losing money fast. Ramsay soon established that what the people of Silsden really want to eat is Beef and Ale Pie and Treacle Tart. Ramsay soon had the restaurant chocker block but what state is it in now?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
Saturday night at The Glass House Restaurant in Ambleside was a disaster. Orders in the kitchen were mixed up, the food wasn't cooked properly and the customers were complaining. Not only was the chef in tears, but the owners were on the brink of bankruptcy.
A few months on, there have been some departures from the Glass House. Who is in charge of the kitchen now? And, more importantly, is Ramsay's Caesar salad still on the menu?

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S04:E09 - Episode 9

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S04:E10 - Episode 10

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The Walnut Tree Inn was in big trouble - there was no head chef, the customers had dwindled, and the owner had been forced to sell the family home to keep the business afloat. Set in beautiful Welsh countryside, The Walnut Tree Inn was a successful business for 37 years and became a national institution. But when Francesco bought the place 3 years ago he made the mistake of turning the warm and welcoming country inn into a cold and stark London-style restaurant. And when things went wrong he tried to run the kitchen as well as the front of house. With its Michelin star in jeopardy, Ramsay's first job was to recruit a new head chef so the owner could concentrate on customers. But has Francesco managed to follow Ramsay's advice and stop meddling in the kitchen?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
Nick and Richard are self-confessed restaurant virgins. They've both had successful careers in the brewery business so when they bought Moore Place they believed they could make it an instant success. What they hadn't realized was just how difficult it would be to fill the 90-seater oak-paneled restaurant and how hard it would be to find a chef who could cook decent food.
Has Ramsay's fast-track guide to restaurant success helped these brewery whiz-kids transform their failing ex-Berni Inn into a profitable business? And is the building still painted that disgusting shade of purple?

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course
programme.desc: S01:E09 - TV Dinners

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The pressure on the chefs to deliver is immense, and even the Great British Menu judges roll up their sleeves to ensure that the banquet goes according to plan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Some of the nation's greatest chefs battle for the chance to cook a glittering Olympic banquet. The feast will honour the hopes and achievements of the country's sporting heroes, and it will be a glorious celebration of Britain's culinary talents. This time it is the battle of the Scottish chefs - returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway must cook their fish course, but which one will prevail? Will it be grilled mackerel with beetroot meringues and horseradish ice cream, crab `cannelloni' or poached halibut with squid ink? Great British Menu veteran Jeremy Lee will decide who goes through to the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Sir Matthew Pinsent takes time out to meet one of the chefs and give them valuable tips on competing at the highest level. All three chefs are determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. This is the big one, the main course, but which one will get top marks? Will it be barbecued veal with macaroni cheese, spinach and watercress; beef rump and terrine; or loin of blackface lamb with sweetbreads?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scottish chefs - returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway. All of them are determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. This is the final chance to impress `Great British Menu' veteran Jeremy Lee with their dessert dishes - `Going for Gold', modern day Eton mess, and beetroot cake with chocolate mousse and fennel ice cream.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is decision time for the chefs from Scotland. The two remaining chefs cook their entire menus for the `Great British Menu' judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges aren't easily pleased and only world class cooking will do. Only one chef can make it through to the national finals to represent Scotland. If they win, one of their dishes could be on the menu at The Olympic Feast.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Central chefs Aktar Islam and Daniel Clifford and newcomer Paul Foster kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be pork neck with ribwort plantain and pork scratchings, veal tartare with caramelised sweetbread and burnt onions or breast of squab with confit leg and chilli and sweetcorn shoots?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Aktar Islam, Daniel Clifford and Paul Foster cook their fish course, but which one will prevail? Will it be poached ray wing with chicken skin and sea vegetables, stuffed red mullet with roasted artichoke and parmesan puree, or pickled mackerel with smoked langoustine and infused coconut milk?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Aktar Islam, Daniel Clifford and Paul Foster cook the big one, the main course, but which one will get top marks? Will it be Goosnargh duck breast and hearts with potatoes cooked in pine, slow poached chicken and sweetcorn egg or coriander crumbed lamb loin with sweetbread bhajis and pea pulao?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the final chance for chefs Aktar Islam, Daniel Clifford and Paul Foster to impress Glynn Purnell as they make their desserts - whipped sea buckthorn with meringue and crispy rice, raspberry and tarragon roulade with cookie dough and tarragon oil, and dark chocolate with raspberry jelly and raspberry sorbet. Plus, paralympian Daniel Greaves offers his advice to one chef.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's decision time for the chefs from the Central region. One chef has already left the competition and only two remain to cook their entire menus for the judges - Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges are not easily pleased and only world class cooking will do. Only one chef can make it through to the national finals to represent the Central region at a glittering Olympic Banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: In this battle of the North East chefs, returning contender Stephanie Moon and newcomers Colin McGurran and Charlie Lakin prepare their respective starters. Which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be Stephanie's goat's cheese, Charlie's wild rabbit with carrot and Douglas fir needles, or Colin's quail in the woods?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contender Stephanie Moon and newcomers Colin McGurran and Charlie Lakin cook their fish course here. Which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be Stephanie's `see food', Charlie's beetroot marinated monkfish with cauliflower and sea radish, or Colin's mullet on the sea bed?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contender Stephanie Moon and newcomers Colin McGurran and Charlie Lakin cook their main course here. Which one will take gold? Will it be Stephanie's `team spirit re-vealed', Charlie's Dexter beef, Littlebourne snails, marrow bone and wild garlic, or Colin's hay-smoked pig's head with mock apple and textures of onion?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contender Stephanie Moon and newcomers Colin McGurran and Charlie Lakin have a chance to impress with their dessert dishes. Will it be Stephanie's `podium of puddings', Charlie's Earl Grey and strawberry souffle with gorse flower ice cream, or Colin's chocolate, rhubarb and custard?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's decision time for the chefs from the North East region. One chef left the competition on the previous day and only two remain to cook their entire menus for the `Great British Menu' judges Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges aren't easily pleased and only world-class cooking will do. Who will make it through to the to represent the North East region in the finals.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: In the battle of the Northern Ireland chefs - returning contenders Chris Fearon, Chris Bell and Niall McKenna begin with their starters. Which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be Chris Bell with tea and biscuits, rabbit, black pudding and rhubarb salad; Niall with pig sweetbreads, black truffle and baked onion; or Chris Fearon with clay pigeon shoot?

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: The Autistic Gardener
programme.desc: The team tackle a neglected garden in north east London, with a budget of just £5,000. However, their work is being bogged down by the non-stop downpours. Will their plans eventually be scuppered?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty assesses the progress, successes and failures of his paradise garden. Elsewhere, Frances Tophill travels to Glasgow to meet a gardener whose hands-off approach to his garden has reaped rewards for wildlife.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team return with a celebration of spring. There's been plenty going on over the winter and lots of new projects in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential rose pruning, Monty plants clematis and rocket, cuts back grasses and makes a start on sowing annuals for colour this summer.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Featuring advice on how to plant spring flowering perennials for instant impact and recommendations for planting bare root roses full of fragrance in borders and pots. Monty will also begin planning the vegetable garden for the year ahead.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring approaches, it's time to get going with sowing seeds and Monty recommends varieties to sow now for months of summer colour. With conifers enjoying a revival, he also plants up a pot to give interest all year round.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxler’s life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. We’ll take a look into Nikki’s life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. We’ll also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Mack’s Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. We’ll even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Mack’s employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. It’s timber holes and tall tales. It’s cups of coffee and cupped up wings. It’s partners in business, and partners in potholes and it’s pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Primos

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: East Alton, Illinois is the home of Winchester Ammunition and the manufacturing home of the shotshell plants that build and produce millions of rounds of ammo for hunters, sport shooters, military and law enforcement. Get an unprecedented inside look at the birth cycle of a shotshell inside the walls of Winchester. From hull to primer, shot to wad and packaging to shipping, watch how the most legendary and successful ammunition brand in the world comes to is born and built.

programme.title: Black Cloud

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "For our second episode of Huckberry Homes, we set our sights on the Oregon coast and flew out to see our friends ‪@ben_moon‬ and Sophie Kuller. Tired of fixing up other people's houses, Ben decided to spend the last few years crafting his own house from the ground up, while getting help from his friends, Dad, and Sophie along the way. This one-of-a-kind home now serves as a gathering place for creatives and surfers alike, nestled between the forest and Oregon coast.On Huckberry Homes, we’ll be tapping into the most inspiring members of the Huckberry community to offer an inside peek into how they’ve crafted the place they call home. We will showcase everything from cold plunges to vinyl listening rooms, home gyms and offices, and other tools that inspire creativity and high-performing lives.We would like to take a moment to acknowledge the Indigenous peoples who have stewarded the land on which this video was created. This area was the home to the Nestucca peoples and other coastal tribes until the mid-1800s when the population was decimated by diseases from settlers. Those who remained were coerced into a coastal reservation by the US government. Let us remember the histories and cultures that have shaped this land."

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners

Shoot straight and come hungry because it's the last hunt of the season.

Cameron gave us the lay of the land, showing us everything from a creative oasis he calls an office, to the places he enjoys most with family and friends.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxler’s life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. We’ll take a look into Nikki’s life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. We’ll also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Mack’s Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. We’ll even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Mack’s employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. It’s timber holes and tall tales. It’s cups of coffee and cupped up wings. It’s partners in business, and partners in potholes and it’s pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.
Chris Schmidt and his son Hunter go after some big east coast bucks and a whopper of a bruin before closing out the season in Kansas.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: Team Primos chases whitetail deer at our home camp, Kudzu Bluff, on the edge of the MS Delta.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: East Alton, Illinois is the home of Winchester Ammunition and the manufacturing home of the shotshell plants that build and produce millions of rounds of ammo for hunters, sport shooters, military and law enforcement. Get an unprecedented inside look at the birth cycle of a shotshell inside the walls of Winchester. From hull to primer, shot to wad and packaging to shipping, watch how the most legendary and successful ammunition brand in the world comes to is born and built.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson heads North to Alberta on a late season Elk hunt. This is a great program that gives back to the wildlife.

programme.title: Black Cloud

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "For our second episode of Huckberry Homes, we set our sights on the Oregon coast and flew out to see our friends ‪@ben_moon‬ and Sophie Kuller. Tired of fixing up other people's houses, Ben decided to spend the last few years crafting his own house from the ground up, while getting help from his friends, Dad, and Sophie along the way. This one-of-a-kind home now serves as a gathering place for creatives and surfers alike, nestled between the forest and Oregon coast.On Huckberry Homes, we’ll be tapping into the most inspiring members of the Huckberry community to offer an inside peek into how they’ve crafted the place they call home. We will showcase everything from cold plunges to vinyl listening rooms, home gyms and offices, and other tools that inspire creativity and high-performing lives.We would like to take a moment to acknowledge the Indigenous peoples who have stewarded the land on which this video was created. This area was the home to the Nestucca peoples and other coastal tribes until the mid-1800s when the population was decimated by diseases from settlers. Those who remained were coerced into a coastal reservation by the US government. Let us remember the histories and cultures that have shaped this land."
