programme.title: Animals with Super Senses
programme.desc: This episode features a variety of animals found on land, and in the sea. Find out how the Beluga Whale uses echolocation to find food. And how an owl can detect the heartbeat of a mouse from 100 feet away.

programme.title: Keystone Species
programme.desc: This episode features a variety of animals found on land, and in the sea. Find out how the anteater is able to eat nearly 10,000 insects every day. And why the walrus is considered a keystone species in the Pacific Northwest.

programme.title: Future Energy
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau looks at renewable sources of energy that can replace our reliance on fossil fuels and consequently, help clean up our atmosphere. Solar panels, wind turbines and hydro-power are clean forms of energy that are being developed and deployed throughout the world. There's also an environment-friendly replacement for gasoline in the form of algae biofuel. Philippe shares all the exciting new developments in this area and gives hope for a healthier future of our planet.

programme.title: Yosemite
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau visits Yosemite National Park, one of the first parks protected by the Federal Government.

programme.title: Animal Athletes
programme.desc: In this episode, we'll examine some of the animal kingdom's fastest sprinters, like the Cheetah. Also, the mysteries of animal intelligence are revealed as we take a look at Dolphins and Orangutans.

programme.title: The Predators
programme.desc: In this episode, we examine some of the world's most fearsome predators. Find out why Owls are the only birds that can fly without making any sound. And how the Leopard uses its amazing night vision to catch its prey.

programme.title: Sicily
programme.desc: Jefferson Graham takes us on a photowalk through Sicily

programme.title: Japan
programme.desc: Jefferson Graham takes us on a photowalk through Japan

programme.title: Marshall Fire
programme.desc: Scripps News puts the 2021 Marshall Fire into focus. The Colorado wildfire, which destroyed more than 1,000 homes and structures in Boulder County, became the most destructive wildfire in state history. More than two years later, many outside Denver are still rebuilding what they lost.

programme.title: Sikh Temple Shooting
programme.desc: Scripps News revisits the the Sikh Temple in Wisconsin in the community of Oak Creek, a site of a tragic shooting on August 5, 2012, where seven worshipers lost their lives to an act fueled by hate and extremism. More than a decade later, we delve into the community's journey of healing, resilience, and the power of forgiveness.

programme.title: Ukraine's Women Warriors
programme.desc: Reported from inside Ukraine. The call to fight for freedom is being answered by Ukrainian women, showcasing their strength and bravery.

programme.title: Weighing The Costs
programme.desc: Amid a surge in demand for weight loss drugs, concerns about safety are growing. Are these drugs effective? Are they safe?

programme.desc: Discover inspirational news, with real-life stories of everyday people who positively impact their communities.

programme.title: Good To Know

programme.title: Outperforming A.I.
programme.desc: Video games rely on skilled human actors to bring their virtual worlds to life. But the rise of generative A.I. has many actors worried about their future in digital performance.

programme.title: Under The Helmet
programme.desc: From the pit lane to the podium, women are ushering in a new era for motorsports with drivers like Jamie Chadwick and Lia Block behind the wheel.

programme.title: Mother Knows Death
programme.desc: A homicide at the intersection of a teenage daughter and her boyfriend who can't get out from underneath a mother's overbearing eye. Once cops unravel the twisted web of lies, they uncover the shocking truth behind a premeditated murder plot.

programme.title: Rage & Anger
programme.desc: The random murder of a woman in Central Montana sends law enforcement on the hunt for a killer. Using a network of informants and good old fashioned methods the authorities track down the mentally unstable man behind the motiveless crime.

programme.title: A Preference For Poison
programme.desc: When a Southern California high school teacher suddenly dies, it appears his death was due to natural causes. But once law enforcement starts looking into his widow, they uncover her treacherous past and her preference for using poison to kill.

programme.title: Mrs. Wrong
programme.desc: A heartbroken millionaire marries a much younger woman who turns out to be Mrs. Wrong. The end result is a shotgun blast to the stomach and a lethal dose of poison.

programme.title: Blood On The Chef's Apron
programme.desc: When a chef's wife goes missing from Southern California, it initially appears she may have voluntarily walked away from the life she knew. Yet, after months of investigation, detectives uncover she was the victim of a ruthless homicide and an even more savage cover up.

programme.title: Process Of Elimination
programme.desc: A vicious custody battle ends when one of the parents vanishes without a trace. Law enforcement investigates the usual suspects only to uncover a seemingly premeditated murder and a sickening attempt to cover it up.

programme.title: Of Disbelief & Death
programme.desc: A controversial family of atheists walks away from their life's work without warning. When law enforcement stops investigating the disappearances, an intrepid journalist picks up the torch and hunts down a mastermind hell-bent on revenge who resulted to kidnapping, extortion and murder.

programme.title: Lethal Payback
programme.desc: Cops in suburban Fort Worth, Texas investigate a brutal killing at a construction site. After months of interviews, extensive forensic analysis, and a massive process of elimination, homicide detectives finally track down a suspect who they've been eyeing from the beginning.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: In “Free Spirit,” award-winning bartender and host Kate Gerwin takes to the road and meets people in their workplaces and their favorite watering holes.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Join host Rob Mariano, also known as Boston Rob from the Survivor series, as he explores the best of Beantown from classic institutions to new local gems.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Plate It!

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.desc: Discover where classic dishes collide to create delightful flavors. From pizza debates to the Juicy Lucy to a good old-fashioned red beer, see how regional creativity transforms beloved foods into something more.

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: Scott's life revolves around everyone's favorite four-legged friends, from rescuing and caring for countless dogs, his spirit is unwavering. Today Meaghan gives back a day full of moments for him and his beloved canine companion.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Comedians, podcasters and craft beer enthusiasts Ed Bailey and Day Bracey explore hot spots, hidden gems and the best places to grab a cold brew in the 'Burgh.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: Local radio personality, Greg Adams, wants to shine a light on all parts of his beloved city and prove that Milwaukee has a lot more to offer than people might expect. In each episode, Greg is joined by a notable personality from the community who shows him their favorite spots and the best ways to experience them.

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: Amanda Machon meets with a different guest each episode who will show off their favorite spots in Albuquerque and the best way to experience this one-of-a-kind city. This series is all about discovering everything that makes ABQ unique and exciting.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: West By Orphan Train
programme.desc: A gripping documentary uncovering real stories of children loaded on trains, sent west, and presented “for the picking.” From 1854 to 1929, over 6,000 children landed in Iowa communities. Discover their emotional journeys and impact on the Midwest.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: Ted wants to live to 100 with his beloved wife beside him. But his oral health threatens his future. Kristy’s a FIXT staffer desperate to smile big on her wedding day. Will love help them face their fears?

programme.title: WXII Local News
programme.desc: Get the latest news and weather from WXII.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: Makers, crafters and artists square off to create the most iconic art piece that best represents their city. From glass-blowers and chalk artists to metalsmiths and tattooers, see who Host Ashley Adams and the judges will crown the victor.

programme.title: Future Energy
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau looks at renewable sources of energy that can replace our reliance on fossil fuels and consequently, help clean up our atmosphere. Solar panels, wind turbines and hydro-power are clean forms of energy that are being developed and deployed throughout the world. There's also an environment-friendly replacement for gasoline in the form of algae biofuel. Philippe shares all the exciting new developments in this area and gives hope for a healthier future of our planet.

programme.title: Yosemite
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau visits Yosemite National Park, one of the first parks protected by the Federal Government.

programme.title: Animal Athletes
programme.desc: In this episode, we'll examine some of the animal kingdom's fastest sprinters, like the Cheetah. Also, the mysteries of animal intelligence are revealed as we take a look at Dolphins and Orangutans.

programme.title: The Predators
programme.desc: In this episode, we examine some of the world's most fearsome predators. Find out why Owls are the only birds that can fly without making any sound. And how the Leopard uses its amazing night vision to catch its prey.

programme.title: Sicily
programme.desc: Jefferson Graham takes us on a photowalk through Sicily

programme.title: Japan
programme.desc: Jefferson Graham takes us on a photowalk through Japan

programme.title: Marshall Fire
programme.desc: Scripps News puts the 2021 Marshall Fire into focus. The Colorado wildfire, which destroyed more than 1,000 homes and structures in Boulder County, became the most destructive wildfire in state history. More than two years later, many outside Denver are still rebuilding what they lost.

programme.title: Sikh Temple Shooting
programme.desc: Scripps News revisits the the Sikh Temple in Wisconsin in the community of Oak Creek, a site of a tragic shooting on August 5, 2012, where seven worshipers lost their lives to an act fueled by hate and extremism. More than a decade later, we delve into the community's journey of healing, resilience, and the power of forgiveness.

programme.title: Ukraine's Women Warriors
programme.desc: Reported from inside Ukraine. The call to fight for freedom is being answered by Ukrainian women, showcasing their strength and bravery.

programme.title: Weighing The Costs
programme.desc: Amid a surge in demand for weight loss drugs, concerns about safety are growing. Are these drugs effective? Are they safe?

programme.title: Outperforming A.I.
programme.desc: Video games rely on skilled human actors to bring their virtual worlds to life. But the rise of generative A.I. has many actors worried about their future in digital performance.

programme.title: Under The Helmet
programme.desc: From the pit lane to the podium, women are ushering in a new era for motorsports with drivers like Jamie Chadwick and Lia Block behind the wheel.

programme.title: Mother Knows Death
programme.desc: A homicide at the intersection of a teenage daughter and her boyfriend who can't get out from underneath a mother's overbearing eye. Once cops unravel the twisted web of lies, they uncover the shocking truth behind a premeditated murder plot.

programme.title: Rage & Anger
programme.desc: The random murder of a woman in Central Montana sends law enforcement on the hunt for a killer. Using a network of informants and good old fashioned methods the authorities track down the mentally unstable man behind the motiveless crime.

programme.title: A Preference For Poison
programme.desc: When a Southern California high school teacher suddenly dies, it appears his death was due to natural causes. But once law enforcement starts looking into his widow, they uncover her treacherous past and her preference for using poison to kill.

programme.title: Mrs. Wrong
programme.desc: A heartbroken millionaire marries a much younger woman who turns out to be Mrs. Wrong. The end result is a shotgun blast to the stomach and a lethal dose of poison.

programme.title: Blood On The Chef's Apron
programme.desc: When a chef's wife goes missing from Southern California, it initially appears she may have voluntarily walked away from the life she knew. Yet, after months of investigation, detectives uncover she was the victim of a ruthless homicide and an even more savage cover up.

programme.title: Process Of Elimination
programme.desc: A vicious custody battle ends when one of the parents vanishes without a trace. Law enforcement investigates the usual suspects only to uncover a seemingly premeditated murder and a sickening attempt to cover it up.

programme.title: Of Disbelief & Death
programme.desc: A controversial family of atheists walks away from their life's work without warning. When law enforcement stops investigating the disappearances, an intrepid journalist picks up the torch and hunts down a mastermind hell-bent on revenge who resulted to kidnapping, extortion and murder.

programme.title: KATC 5:30 pm News
programme.desc: KATC News in Acadiana - The latest local and national news and local weather, traffic and sports.

programme.title: Judgment Of The Insurance Money Murder With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Ten years after being found guilty of the murder of her husband, Susie Mowbray’s conviction was overturned, and she would once again face a jury of her peers. Would a second jury believe her story that Bill Mowbray was a severely depressed man who took his own life? Or would the prosecution once again prove she was a cold-blooded killer?

programme.desc: This episode features a variety of animals found on land, and in the sea. Find out how the anteater is able to eat nearly 10,000 insects every day. And why the walrus is considered a keystone species in the Pacific Northwest.
